Reviews.Title: “Cheap plus convenient, a rarity in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: USAJAPAN
Reviews.Content: The last time I came to Singapore over a year ago, I really liked Little India compared to any other area. The food is cheap and the Mustafa Center area had everything I needed for souvenirs, food, Internet cafe, etc. This time I did a search on Google Maps for hotels close to the Mustafa Center that were cheap. I found Penta Hotel but didn't realize how close it was. It is only 1 minute from the Mustafa Center and big street that has many Indian/Middle Eastern restaurants. The room is basic but has free Wi-fi and cable tv with good movie channels. There is a convenient store next door for late night drinks or munchies. This hotel is on Birch Street which most drivers did not know so the best thing may be to have them drop you off in front of the mosque. It is next door to the hotel and they know it. The hotel is also a stones throw from Ferrer Park Subway Station if you want to save cash, I paid 100 Singapore Dollars for my double room with a window. 90 if you are ok to have no window. The desk staff was nice. Walls are thin though and a lot of people just hanging out in front of the hotel or near the elevators which may be a turn off for some, Overall though, for those that just need a place to crash for a night or 2 and convenient, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Low rent”
Reviews.Author: iamanumenorean
Reviews.Content: Just opposite Serangoon Plaza (main entrance of Mustafas) behind a mosque. Run by an elderly chinese couple. OK if you just want to sleep. No breakfast/dining facilities. Only thing you get is hot/cold water and sachets of dehydrated tea or coffee. However, being so close to Mustafa's there are a number of 24 hr food joints very close. Adjacent to Farrer Park MRT entrance. Free wifi with decent speeds. 3-bed room was for 140SGD.

Reviews.Title: “Can anyone give me the tariff for the stay there”
Reviews.Author: MathanaJ
Reviews.Content: Can anyone give me the tariff for the stay there, preferrably a private double room And was there complimentary breakfast Any site link to this hotel.... please do inform (kalaimathan@yahoo.com)

Reviews.Title: “Quite acceptable if you just want to sleep at night”
Reviews.Author: ychan84
Reviews.Content: Good things: 1) The front receptionist at that time (Nancy) was accommodating. 2) Free WiFi 3) Less than 1-minute walk from Ferrar Park MRT station 4) Less than 5-minute walk from Mustafa Complex, and arrays of Indian restaurants Bad things: 1) Room cleanliness could be improved. Found strands of hair on towel provided. Bottom line: My stay was mainly to have a bed to sleep on at night, as I visited many places during the day, so I came back to hotel quite late. Therefore it was good enough for me.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Rude Receptionists”
Reviews.Author: aizaz_27
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good for travellers who by compulsion have to live near KK Hospital(like us) or want to be in the Little India district. However rest of the things relating to the Hotel are simply pathetic to say the least. The balding male receptionist and the older female receptionist are both rude to the core. Rather than assissting the guest they make sure that the guests are bullied. For every question asked, be prepared to get a rude curt reply, which most of the time is nonsensical. The Manager should take notice of this and immediately remove these two people. The rooms are ok but the amenities are basic. The fridge in our room was not working and our children's medicine were spoiled because of that. Only travellers who have no other option to stay elsewhere should stay.

Reviews.Title: “Shoppers Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: kutty_king
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated Very Close To Mustafa Centre, Singapore, So shopping made easy when you stay at this place, this place has good hospitality, and you can get good Indian food just outside the hotel, This is a recommended place for a budget traveler to stay peacefully and enjoy the scenic Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “16 hour stay”
Reviews.Author: mysvar
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Penta. Housekeeping standards are down but they are still just adequate. Location, proximity to MRT, cheapness of stay, proximity to several excellent restaurants and priced at 90SGD for a day was enough for me. It is a comfortable place for a day or two without any frills.

Reviews.Title: “Small & Cheap”
Reviews.Author: shirzadb
Reviews.Content: Small Rooms, very economical stay, very close to Mustafa Mall, vicinity of the Hotel makes you feel, you are amongst Indians. For a quick stop over stay at very affordable price it is a good bet. Not too far from the airport and good connect of rail & road transport. Good Indian food served in restaurants around in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HPTC
Reviews.Content: Basic Hotel but Situated in a nice location, very convenient for many things and to go around...

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: sundomain
Reviews.Content: First of all what strikes you is the location of this hotel. It has (on either side) the Farrer Park MRT (train) station and the highly popular Mustafa Centre just a dozen meters away. I chose this hotel on recommendation of a friend living in Singapore. I heard from him that the hotel was refurbished a few weeks or so before my date of arrival in Singapore. I checked in to a double room and it cost S$100-a-day (~US$80). I didn't expect a lot of pleasantness because i knew the owners were Chinese, but by their standards, the reception wasn't cold and more towards pleasant. It's just accommodation that is offered at Penta and not even bed tea; although they do sell tea/coffee powder sachets for 30c at the reception. A hot/cold water dispenser is available in the corridor and a flask is provided with the room. The room was clean and so was the washroom. The A/C was good but i did not use the TV enough to comment on it. I did find a few other hotels in the area (e.g. GrandMax Hotel) that offered accommodation for S$75 (~US$60) but the state and cleanliness of those hotels gave me enough reason to remain at Penta. Overall, it's a good hotel if you are looking for comfortable yet affordable and reasonable accommodation in Singapore. Bon Voyage!

Reviews.Title: “cosy little hotel literally opposite to station”
Reviews.Author: dftw
Reviews.Content: nicer than expected. i was here for the singapore marathon. excellent location - literally 50 metres from Farrer Road MRT station (Birch road exit). would like to think this is a gem in the area. room clean and cosy (but not spectacular). price about SG80. reliable service. strong shower with hot water. multipe tv channels (the only credible one is CNN tho). value for money for those with spare pennies but cannot afford extravagance.

HotelInfo.Name: Penta Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 33 Birch Road, Singapore 219894 , Singapore
